title: Case Study: Progressive Muscle Weakness in a Patient with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis
clinical_history: A 55-year-old male patient, a former software engineer, presented with a 6-month history of progressive muscle weakness and wasting in his right arm. He initially noticed difficulty lifting his arm and performing daily activities such as dressing and brushing his teeth. Over time, his symptoms have worsened, and he now experiences weakness in his left arm and both legs. He reports difficulty walking and requires assistance with transfers. He also experiences dysphagia and occasional dysarthria.
